figure_2.title: Figure 2.
figure_2.caption: The role of therapeutic hospital gardens—themes and subthemes.

figure_3.title: Figure 3.
figure_3.caption: Terminology used to describe hospital gardens in the 28 articles.

figure_5.title: Figure 5.
figure_5.caption: Framing of the therapeutic hospital garden definition.

claims.sentence: The full-text screening process yielded 28 articles for the literature review analysis as summarized in Figure 1.
The distilled three themes and 14 subthemes are discussed below and according to the thematic sequence presented in Figure 2.

The results of the 28 articles evidenced in Table 6 and Figure 2 illustrate the themes and subthemes and the interconnectedness of definition, user needs and experiences, and the benefits and values of THGs.

A THG can mean different things to different people, therefore making it necessary to say what makes THGs, how they are used and by whom, and importantly how such gardens can be established successfully
.Typologies (Theme 1.1)
Various terms were used in the 28 articles to name the clinical setting and this diversity of terminology, as presented in Figure 3, ranged from conceptual descriptions such as nature or nature experience to specific descriptions such as gardens or healing gardens.
Figure 4 presents a summary of the theoretical contexts.

Title

Staniewska (2022), Land

“Gardens of Historic Mental Health Hospitals and Their Potential Use for Green Therapy Purposes”
Gardens in former psychiatric institution may be suitable for today’s use in nature therapy.
Figure 5 illustrates the framing of the THGs in the themes and subthemes.
The full-text screening process yielded 28 articles for the literature review analysis as summarized in Figure 1.
The distilled three themes and 14 subthemes are discussed below and according to the thematic sequence presented in Figure 2.

The results of the 28 articles evidenced in Table 6 and Figure 2 illustrate the themes and subthemes and the interconnectedness of definition, user needs and experiences, and the benefits and values of THGs.

A THG can mean different things to different people, therefore making it necessary to say what makes THGs, how they are used and by whom, and importantly how such gardens can be established successfully
.Typologies (Theme 1.1)
Various terms were used in the 28 articles to name the clinical setting and this diversity of terminology, as presented in Figure 3, ranged from conceptual descriptions such as nature or nature experience to specific descriptions such as gardens or healing gardens.
Figure 4 presents a summary of the theoretical contexts.
